TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit NavigationEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for non-cancelable navigation events, including <see cref="E:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.LoadCompleted">, <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigated>, and <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.NavigationStopped>.
Gets the root node of the target page's content.
Docs.value: The root element of the target page's content.

Docs.summary: Gets an optional user-defined data object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you call <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> to navigate to a new page, you have the option of passing the method a user-defined data object. That object is then assigned to this property so that you have easy access to the data when you handle the <xref:System.Windows.Navigation.NavigationWindow.Navigate%2A> event.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the current navigator initiated the navigation.
Docs.value: `true` if the navigation was initiated inside the current frame; `false` if the parent navigator is also navigating.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property indicates whether the current navigator is initiating the navigation or whether a parent navigator is being navigated. For example, the current navigator might be a frame inside a page that is being navigated to inside a parent navigator. You can use this property to determine whether to spin the globe on a `Navigating` event or to stop spinning the globe on a `LoadCompleted` event. If this property is `false`, the navigator's parent navigator is also navigating and the globe is already spinning. If this property is `true`, the navigation was initiated inside the current frame and you should spin the globe (or stop spinning the globe, depending on which event is being handled.)

Docs.summary: Gets the navigator that raised the event
Docs.value: The navigator that raised the event.

Docs.summary: Gets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](../../add/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the target page.
Gets the Web response to allow access to HTTP headers and other properties.
